Package dk.via.sep.server.networking.userServerHandler

Class UserServerHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • dk.via.sep.server.networking.userServerHandler.UserServerHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserServer, UserServerCallback, java.rmi.Remote
    public class UserServerHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements UserServer
    The user server implementation, that handles all user related actions, such as logging in, registering, etc.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      UserServerHandler​(UserServerModel userServerModel)
      Public constructor that initializes the server model and makes this object remotely available for the client to use through the callback interface.

      Method used to log out the client.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserServerHandler

        public UserServerHandler​(UserServerModel userServerModel)
        Public constructor that initializes the server model and makes this object remotely available for the client to use through the callback interface.
        Parameters:
        userServerModel - the user server model created by the model factory.

    • Method Detail

      • registerClient

        public void registerClient​(UserClientCallback client,
                           java.util.UUID clientID)
        Method used to register the client for callbacks. Each callback will need it's own PropertyChangeListener created as a field variable, and it's own UserAction enum, and follow the structure shown below.
        Specified by:
        registerClient in interface UserServerCallback
        Parameters:
        client - the client callback interface.
        clientID - the client's UUID.

      • login

        public User login​(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
        Method used to log in a user into the app. It works by calling the server model and requesting a user with the specified credentials. If there is a user with such credentials, it will be returned, otherwise, a null user will be returned, notifying the client that either the username or the password are not correct.
        Specified by:
        login in interface UserServerCallback
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user.
        password - the password of the user.
        Returns:
        the user that matches the credentials from the parameters.

      • registerAccount

        public boolean registerAccount​(User user)
        Method used to register a user into the database. The user object needs to be created by the client and passed down as an argument.
        Specified by:
        registerAccount in interface UserServerCallback
        Parameters:
        user - the user to be registered.
        Returns:
        boolean if the register process was a success or failed.

      • logOut

        public void logOut()
        Method used to log out the client. Currently, not necessary, but the event listeners will remain even after a client is disconnected. If the server tries to call a client that is no longer available, the error will be caught and the listener will be removed. That is not a permanent solution.
        Specified by:
        logOut in interface UserServerCallback

      • getUserList

        public java.util.ArrayList<User> getUserList()
        Method used to get the list of users that exist currently in the database.
        Specified by:
        getUserList in interface UserServerCallback
        Returns:
        the list of users.

      • getActiveUsers

        public java.util.ArrayList<User> getActiveUsers()
        Method used to get the list of currently active users. Warning: this method will return an empty list, as it has not been finished. It will be usable in a future release.
        Specified by:
        getActiveUsers in interface UserServerCallback
        Returns:
        the list of currently active users.

      • deleteAccount

        public void deleteAccount​(User user)
        Method used to delete a user's account from the database.
        Specified by:
        deleteAccount in interface UserServerCallback
        Parameters:
        user - the user to be deleted.

      • editUserDetails

        public void editUserDetails​(User user,
                            java.util.UUID clientID)
        Method used to edit a user's credentials. You need to provide the client's UUID so the profile tab updates correctly on the client's side.
        Specified by:
        editUserDetails in interface UserServerCallback
        Parameters:
        user - the user to be edited, along with the new details.
        clientID - the client's UUID
